thread.title: Deutsche Bank Asset-Management IPO Pricing Values Unit at Up to $8.9 Billion

author: Jenny Strasburg
title: Deutsche Bank Asset-Management IPO Pricing Values Unit at Up to $8.9 Billion

organizations.name: deutsche bank asset-management ipo pricing values unit

text:
Deutsche fund management IPO values unit at up to €7.2bn Japan’s Nippon Life will be cornerstone investor in DWS Group with 5% stake By Jenny Strasburg March 12, 2018 Updated: 7:47 a.m. GMT 
Deutsche Bank has said said the share pricing for the coming partial float of its asset management unit values the business at €6bn to €7.2bn and announced a “cornerstone” investor in the offering, Japan’s Nippon Life Insurance. 
Deutsche Bank said it would sell 20% of the unit, DWS Group, in an offering range of €30 to €36 a share. The first day of trading will be March 23 on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange, the German lender said in a statement. ... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In Filter by Topic
